knowledge: Fairy . Morgan le Fay, whose connection to the realm of Faerie is implied in her name, in "Le Morte d'Arthur" is a woman whose magic powers stem from study. While somewhat diminished with time, fairies never completely vanished from the tradition. "Sir Gawain and the Green Knight" is a late tale, but the Green Knight himself is an otherworldly being. In many works of fiction, fairies are freely mixed with the nymphs and satyrs of classical tradition, while in others (e.g., Lamia), they were seen as displacing the Classical beings. 15th-century poet and monk John Lydgate wrote that King Arthur was crowned in "the land of the fairy" and taken in his death by four fairy queens, to Avalon, where he lies under a "fairy hill", until he is needed again.
